[![[attachments/RWE_submits_1.2_offshore_application__Windpower_Monthly.1.resources/unknown_filename.16.gif]]](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/home) in * [Home](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/home/) * **[**News**](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/news/)** * [In Depth](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/indepth/) * [Regions](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/regions/) * [Reports](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/go/specialreports/) * [Events](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/events/) * [Jobs](http://www.windindustryjobs.com) * [Directory](http://directory.windpowermonthly.com/) * [Free Trial](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/go/freetrial/) * [Subscribe](https://www.subscription.co.uk/hay/products/windpower.html) * [Windpower TV](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/go/windtv1) [![[attachments/RWE_submits_1.2_offshore_application__Windpower_Monthly.1.resources/unknown_filename.7.gif]]](http://ad.uk.doubleclick.net/click;h=v8/3c28/0/0/%2a/b;252459447;0-0;0;41765559;42379-958/30;46288273/46305286/1;;~sscs=%3fhttp://www.windpowerexpo.org/about/upload/WINDPOWER-2012-Event-Brochure.pdf) * RWE submits 1.2 offshore application # RWE Submits 1.2 offshore Application [James Quilter](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/news/author/3459/), Windpower Monthly, 27 February 2012, 9:12am UK: The application submitted by RWE Npower for its 1.2GW Triton Knoll offshore wind farm off the coast of eastern England has been accepted by the UK's Infrastructure Planning Commission (IPC). The application will now pass into the IPC’s examination process. RWE Npower’s submission included details of the feedback from its 42-day consultation exercise. Jacob Hain, Triton Knoll project manager at RWE Npower called it a major step forward for the project. He said preliminary work on the scheme was already progressing. "So far, during assessments for Triton Knoll we have already placed contracts with vessel operators around the wind farm site that exceed £3 million" he said. # RWE Submits 1.2 offshore Application

[James Quilter](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/news/author/3459/), Windpower Monthly, 27 February 2012, 9:12am

UK: The application submitted by RWE Npower for its 1.2GW Triton Knoll offshore wind farm off the coast of eastern England has been accepted by the UK's Infrastructure Planning Commission (IPC).

The application will now pass into the IPC’s examination process. RWE Npower’s submission included details of the feedback from its 42-day consultation exercise.

Jacob Hain, Triton Knoll project manager at RWE Npower called it a major step forward for the project. He said preliminary work on the scheme was already progressing. "So far, during assessments for Triton Knoll we have already placed contracts with vessel operators around the wind farm site that exceed £3 million" he said.

      [![[attachments/RWE_submits_1.2_offshore_application__Windpower_Monthly.1.resources/unknown_filename.1.jpeg]]](http://ad.uk.doubleclick.net/activity;src%3D2926703%3Bmet%3D1%3Bv%3D1%3Bpid%3D73775121%3Baid%3D248063398%3Bko%3D0%3Bcid%3D44785636%3Brid%3D44803424%3Brv%3D2%3Bcs%3Dd%3Beid1%3D687302%3Becn1%3D1%3Betm1%3D0%3B_dc_redir%3Durl%3fhttp://ad.uk.doubleclick.net/click%3Bh%3Dv8/3c28/3/0/%2a/n%3B248063398%3B0-0%3B0%3B73775121%3B4307-300/250%3B44785636/44803424/2%3B%3B%7Efdr%3D248961282%3B0-0%3B0%3B41765559%3B4307-300/250%3B45088119/45105907/1%3B%3B%7Esscs%3D%3fhttp://worldofwind.vestas.com/1gw/)   

[![[attachments/RWE_submits_1.2_offshore_application__Windpower_Monthly.1.resources/unknown_filename.11.jpeg]]](http://ad.uk.doubleclick.net/click%3Bh%3Dv8/3c28/3/0/%2a/g%3B253611315%3B0-0%3B0%3B41765559%3B4307-300/250%3B46697165/46713643/1%3B%3B%7Esscs%3D%3fhttp://www.globalwindpower.com/projects-for-sale/development-done-differently.aspx)    

Triton Knoll will be located in the North Sea 20 miles off the coast of Lincolnshire and 28 miles from the coast of North Norfolk.

* RWE submits 1.2 offshore application
# RWE Submits 1.2 offshore Application
[James Quilter](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/news/author/3459/), Windpower Monthly, 27 February 2012, 9:12am
UK: The application submitted by RWE Npower for its 1.2GW Triton Knoll offshore wind farm off the coast of eastern England has been accepted by the UK's Infrastructure Planning Commission (IPC).
The application will now pass into the IPC’s examination process. RWE Npower’s submission included details of the feedback from its 42-day consultation exercise.
Jacob Hain, Triton Knoll project manager at RWE Npower called it a major step forward for the project. He said preliminary work on the scheme was already progressing. "So far, during assessments for Triton Knoll we have already placed contracts with vessel operators around the wind farm site that exceed £3 million" he said.
[![[attachments/RWE_submits_1.2_offshore_application__Windpower_Monthly.1.resources/unknown_filename.1.jpeg]]](http://ad.uk.doubleclick.net/activity;src%3D2926703%3Bmet%3D1%3Bv%3D1%3Bpid%3D73775121%3Baid%3D248063398%3Bko%3D0%3Bcid%3D44785636%3Brid%3D44803424%3Brv%3D2%3Bcs%3Dd%3Beid1%3D687302%3Becn1%3D1%3Betm1%3D0%3B_dc_redir%3Durl%3fhttp://ad.uk.doubleclick.net/click%3Bh%3Dv8/3c28/3/0/%2a/n%3B248063398%3B0-0%3B0%3B73775121%3B4307-300/250%3B44785636/44803424/2%3B%3B%7Efdr%3D248961282%3B0-0%3B0%3B41765559%3B4307-300/250%3B45088119/45105907/1%3B%3B%7Esscs%3D%3fhttp://worldofwind.vestas.com/1gw/)
[![[attachments/RWE_submits_1.2_offshore_application__Windpower_Monthly.1.resources/unknown_filename.11.jpeg]]](http://ad.uk.doubleclick.net/click%3Bh%3Dv8/3c28/3/0/%2a/g%3B253611315%3B0-0%3B0%3B41765559%3B4307-300/250%3B46697165/46713643/1%3B%3B%7Esscs%3D%3fhttp://www.globalwindpower.com/projects-for-sale/development-done-differently.aspx)
Triton Knoll will be located in the North Sea 20 miles off the coast of Lincolnshire and 28 miles from the coast of North Norfolk.

[James Quilter](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/news/author/3459/), Windpower Monthly, 27 February 2012, 9:12am

UK: The application submitted by RWE Npower for its 1.2GW Triton Knoll offshore wind farm off the coast of eastern England has been accepted by the UK's Infrastructure Planning Commission (IPC).

The application will now pass into the IPC’s examination process. RWE Npower’s submission included details of the feedback from its 42-day consultation exercise.

Jacob Hain, Triton Knoll project manager at RWE Npower called it a major step forward for the project. He said preliminary work on the scheme was already progressing. Triton Knoll will be located in the North Sea 20 miles off the coast of Lincolnshire and 28 miles from the coast of North Norfolk.

# RWE Submits 1.2 offshore Application

[James Quilter](http://www.windpowermonthly.com/news/author/3459/), Windpower Monthly, 27 February 2012, 9:12am

UK:

The application submitted by RWE Npower for its 1.2GW Triton Knoll offshore wind farm off the coast of eastern England has been accepted by the UK's Infrastructure Planning Commission (IPC).

The application will now pass into the IPC’s examination process.

RWE Npower’s submission included details of the feedback from its 42-day consultation exercise.

Jacob Hain, Triton Knoll project manager at RWE Npower called it a major step forward for the project.

He said preliminary work on the scheme was already progressing.

"So far, during assessments for Triton Knoll we have already placed contracts with vessel operators around the wind farm site that exceed £3 million" he said.

;" width="0px" height="0px" style="visibility:hidden" BORDER="0"/> 

border="0" alt="" /> 

Triton Knoll will be located in the North Sea 20 miles off the coast of Lincolnshire and 28 miles from the coast of North Norfolk.

--- tags: - TECHNOLOGY - LEGAL - DATA - COMPLIANCE source: https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?tab=wm#inbox/15a8e77f015f30f1 title: Will Your Business be GDPR Ready date created: Monday, March 6th 2017, 12:00:57 pm date modified: Wednesday, May 21st 2025, 3:24:09 pm language: en --- # Will Your Business Be GDPR Ready Will Your Business be GDPR Ready? Participantes: newsletter@sharpcloud.com, jose.cordovilla@solvereglobal.com [Abrir conversación en Gmail](https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?tab=wm#inbox/15a8e77f015f30f1) **Nicky Clarke** 2 March 2017 at 11:01
Will Your Business be GDPR Ready?
By Sarim Khan (Co-founder & CEO), February 28 2017

Gartner predicts that, “By the end of 2018, over 50% of companies affected by the GDPR will not be in full compliance with its requirements.”*

In less than 18 months, the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) will require global organisations to control, process and protect the personal data of EU citizens at a much higher level than they do now.

The GDPR sets strict limits on businesses that collect, use, and share data from European citizens. Companies, EU-based or otherwise, face new requirements that compel them to rethink their approaches to customer privacy and implement new protections.

 

Read more »
 

SharpCloud   Southbank Technopark  90 London Road  London,  Greater London   SE1 6LN   UK

# Will Your Business Be GDPR Ready

Will Your Business be GDPR Ready?

Participantes: newsletter@sharpcloud.com, jose.cordovilla@solvereglobal.com

[Abrir conversación en Gmail](https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?tab=wm#inbox/15a8e77f015f30f1)

**Nicky Clarke** 2 March 2017 at 11:01

Will Your Business be GDPR Ready?
By Sarim Khan (Co-founder & CEO), February 28 2017

**Gartner predicts that, “By the end of 2018, over 50% of companies affected by the GDPR will not be in full compliance with its requirements.”***

In less than 18 months, the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) will require global organisations to control, process and protect the personal data of EU citizens at a much higher level than they do now.

The GDPR sets strict limits on businesses that collect, use, and share data from European citizens. Companies, EU-based or otherwise, face new requirements that compel them to rethink their approaches to customer privacy and implement new protections.

 ****
